messages: b4e23593ef02e114f30b5b85761fe1e4 (03:14): I'm really surprised that the X2100's SATA controller isnt supported in the SATA framework
33ed8c96b2b06385e426e5bcf6935cf8 (03:16): elektronkind: are you getting that from the s10u2 release notes? if you are, my belief is that's incorrect
33ed8c96b2b06385e426e5bcf6935cf8 (03:16): the document, that is
83c40fe33385c596f672ec2df316004b (03:17): jmcpAtSun: any idea about prstat -z?
33ed8c96b2b06385e426e5bcf6935cf8 (03:17): I'm zoned out :)
b4e23593ef02e114f30b5b85761fe1e4 (03:18): jmcpAtSun: I patched up a s10u1 x2100 with the patches included with s10u2... maybe the sata packages weren't installed with the patches...
33ed8c96b2b06385e426e5bcf6935cf8 (03:18): you'd need the packages as well
b4e23593ef02e114f30b5b85761fe1e4 (03:18): seems not to be at a second glance
33ed8c96b2b06385e426e5bcf6935cf8 (03:19): elektronkind: what do you actually mean by "not supported in the SATA framework" ?
b4e23593ef02e114f30b5b85761fe1e4 (03:20): well, nothing returned in 'modinfo | grep sata'
b4e23593ef02e114f30b5b85761fe1e4 (03:20): this is after applying the s10u2 patches to a s10u1 box
33ed8c96b2b06385e426e5bcf6935cf8 (03:20): elektronkind: when you run cfgadm -la do you see any "sata" instances?
b4e23593ef02e114f30b5b85761fe1e4 (03:21): nope. only usb apid's on this x2100
33ed8c96b2b06385e426e5bcf6935cf8 (03:21): elektronkind: hang on a moment
b4e23593ef02e114f30b5b85761fe1e4 (03:22): the patches I used were on the s10u2 iso image in Solaris_10/UpgradePatches
b4e23593ef02e114f30b5b85761fe1e4 (03:24): and I took heed of note 24 in the 118855 readme
b4e23593ef02e114f30b5b85761fe1e4 (03:25): yup, it seems to be there:
b4e23593ef02e114f30b5b85761fe1e4 (03:25): [root@grinder]/>ls -l /kernel/misc/amd64/sata
b4e23593ef02e114f30b5b85761fe1e4 (03:25): -rwxr-xr-x   1 root     sys       101480 May 26 18:32 /kernel/misc/amd64/sata*
b4e23593ef02e114f30b5b85761fe1e4 (03:26): I guess the integrated sata controller on the x2100's nvidia CK8-04 chipset wasn't in the plans?
b4e23593ef02e114f30b5b85761fe1e4 (03:27): bummer dude
33ed8c96b2b06385e426e5bcf6935cf8 (03:27): it shows up with the legacy sata support
33ed8c96b2b06385e426e5bcf6935cf8 (03:31): jamesd: I'll channel you a sympathy packet :)
b8ac460f16efd92d9e259415a4930199 (03:33): there was a pen? that got lost in the way :P
a52cfbb622e51e16f2dd4351288d4374 (03:38): the pen is nifty
6c728b2ae6e0bdb14ac212ed5f74c1d8 (03:39): elektronkind: bid 6296435 ? EBay ?
6c728b2ae6e0bdb14ac212ed5f74c1d8 (03:40): elektronkind: Ah... I was wondering what you want to do with "the rifle (defunct) which killed mugaro kabila, ex-dictator in africa"
b4e23593ef02e114f30b5b85761fe1e4 (03:40): or in the politically-correct world, "challenge id"
b4e23593ef02e114f30b5b85761fe1e4 (03:40): nrubsig: rof
b4e23593ef02e114f30b5b85761fe1e4 (03:42): that would be a macabre collection... a collection of assassination weapons.

6c728b2ae6e0bdb14ac212ed5f74c1d8 (03:42): elektronkind: politically correct ? This the slaughtering of innocent using eletrical components political correct ? Is it politically correct to exhibit their corpse in the web like in http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/8/8a/H96566k.jpg ?
b4e23593ef02e114f30b5b85761fe1e4 (03:43): hey, it's awesome that pic exists (if it's real)
33ed8c96b2b06385e426e5bcf6935cf8 (03:43): pop pop pop!
b8ac460f16efd92d9e259415a4930199 (03:44): ahh, i feel so much better now
b4e23593ef02e114f30b5b85761fe1e4 (03:45): maybe solaris could use a "cosine tape" driver (whatever a "cosine tape" is)
6c728b2ae6e0bdb14ac212ed5f74c1d8 (03:45): elektronkind: better we get iSCSI tape emulation via file
b4e23593ef02e114f30b5b85761fe1e4 (03:46): that would be either incredibly useful, or just crazy.
53303ac79660a60ff15ef2ae2835996f (03:46): iSCSI tape library emulation.
b4e23593ef02e114f30b5b85761fe1e4 (03:46): of course that file would have to be mounted over NFS.
6c728b2ae6e0bdb14ac212ed5f74c1d8 (03:47): elektronkind: it is very usefull for script testing
6c728b2ae6e0bdb14ac212ed5f74c1d8 (03:47): elektronkind: and to test your stuff BEFORE you screw up the real hardware.
62115b1ea90366cbcce7a495fa28cbce (03:47): wuss :P
53303ac79660a60ff15ef2ae2835996f (03:48): but then you'll just lose any confidence you had before if you go ahead and screw up the REAL hardware, anyway, after careful testing.
b4e23593ef02e114f30b5b85761fe1e4 (03:48): hey, I really enjoy walking a mile across campus to un-stick a stuck tape robot.
b4e23593ef02e114f30b5b85761fe1e4 (03:48): espeially since my tape robot SUCKS.
53303ac79660a60ff15ef2ae2835996f (03:48): multi-frame goodness.
33ed8c96b2b06385e426e5bcf6935cf8 (03:49): oooh badness
6c728b2ae6e0bdb14ac212ed5f74c1d8 (03:49): The 14:00h backup script was his doom.
b4e23593ef02e114f30b5b85761fe1e4 (03:50): should stuck a bar code on him and see if the robot would try to pick him up and load him
6c728b2ae6e0bdb14ac212ed5f74c1d8 (03:50): elektronkind: lesson learned: keep the med kits always up to date. theirs was eight years old and parts of the stuff was just dust.

6c728b2ae6e0bdb14ac212ed5f74c1d8 (03:52): elektronkind: he was lucky because the computer room was crowded. and since the ZAM is part of a large research facility, one of the largest in germany/europe there are always competent people around for first aid.
b4e23593ef02e114f30b5b85761fe1e4 (03:52): "sure it's ok! why, this flaking, disintigrating gause helps promote clotting!"
6c728b2ae6e0bdb14ac212ed5f74c1d8 (03:53): The door now has two switches and two manual "STOP" buttons, inside AND outside.
b4e23593ef02e114f30b5b85761fe1e4 (03:53): does the robot do a "deadman pass" before it kicks off into full gear on this ZAM?
6c728b2ae6e0bdb14ac212ed5f74c1d8 (03:53): I mean one inside the tape worm and one outside.
6c728b2ae6e0bdb14ac212ed5f74c1d8 (03:54): elektronkind: ?!
b58b6da33b36acabd1b7a600410e5326 (03:54): once around at low power looking for obstructions to calibrate?
6c728b2ae6e0bdb14ac212ed5f74c1d8 (03:55): elektronkind: ZAM = http://www.fz-juelich.de/zam/
